📌 Fast-Food Ordering System API Documentation

This API manages Telegram users, products, categories, and orders in a fast-food ordering system.

🔑 Authentication

  • API Key Authentication - Required for certain endpoints.
  • Token Authentication - Required for user-specific actions.

🛠 Models

1️⃣ TelegramUsers

Represents a Telegram user who interacts with the bot.

  • telegram_id (Integer) – Unique Telegram ID.
  • username (String, nullable) – Telegram username.
  • phone_number (String) – User’s phone number.
  • telegram_name (String) – Display name in Telegram.
  • real_name (String, nullable) – User’s real name.
  • latitude (Decimal, nullable) – User's location latitude.
  • longitude (Decimal, nullable) – User's location longitude.
  • created_at (DateTime) – Timestamp when added.
  • updated_at (DateTime) – Timestamp when last updated.

2️⃣ Category

Represents a category for products.

  • name (String) – Category name.
  • created_at (DateTime) – Timestamp when created.
  • updated_at (DateTime) – Timestamp when last updated.

3️⃣ Product

Represents an available food product.

  • name (String) – Product name.
  • description (Text, nullable) – Product description.
  • price (Decimal) – Price of the product.
  • category_id (Foreign Key) – Associated category.
  • image (Image, nullable) – Product image.
  • is_available (Boolean) – Availability status.
  • created_at (DateTime) – Timestamp when created.
  • updated_at (DateTime) – Timestamp when last updated.

4️⃣ Order

Represents an order placed by a user.

  • user (Foreign Key) – Associated Telegram user.
  • products (ManyToMany) – Ordered products.
  • total_price (Decimal) – Total cost of the order.
  • status (String) – Order status (e.g., pending, confirmed, delivered).
  • created_at (DateTime) – Timestamp when created.
  • updated_at (DateTime) – Timestamp when last updated.

🔗 API Endpoints

POST /api/telegram-users/ – Create a new Telegram user.

GET /api/telegram-users/all – Retrieve all Telegram users.

GET /api/telegram-users/<id>/ – Retrieve a specific Telegram user.

GET /api/products/ – Retrieve all products.

POST /api/products/create – Add a new product.

GET /api/products/<id>/ – Retrieve or update a product.

GET /api/category/ – Retrieve all categories.

POST /api/category/ – Create a new category.

GET /api/category/<id>/ – Retrieve or update a category.

📌 Notes

  • All requests requiring authentication must include a valid token or API key.
  • Use JSON format for request payloads.
